intro: Ozodia, commonly known as the sacred lotus of India, is a flowering plant belonging to the Nelumbonaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom on long, slender stalks rising from water. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that float on the surface of still water. Ozodia is known for its symbolic significance in Hindu and Buddhist cultures. Its botanical features make it an important species in aquatic ecosystems and traditional medicine.
